content.body: zcorpan: I think I said as much in that issue?
content.formatted_body: zcorpan: I think I said as much in that issue?

content.body: I agree it was a mistake. I also think that preconnect requiring a definition ahead of time of whether the resource would be CORS-enabled or not is bad. (this may be a Chromium-only requirement, not sure)

* I agree it was a mistake. I also think that preconnect requiring a definition ahead of time of whether the resources eventually fetched on it would be CORS-enabled or not is bad. (this may be a Chromium-only requirement, not sure)

m.new_content.body: I agree it was a mistake. I also think that preconnect requiring a definition ahead of time of whether the resources eventually fetched on it would be CORS-enabled or not is bad. (this may be a Chromium-only requirement, not sure)

content.body: I think Firefox got it right at the time, but Chromium net code wasn't amenable to align with that.
I don't even understand how the `crossorigin` was made to apply to same-origin fetches. Was there a brief period where fonts were not fetched with credentials ever or some such?
content.formatted_body: I don't even understand how the crossorigin was made to apply to same-origin fetches. Was there a brief period where fonts were not fetched with credentials ever or some such?

content.body: But even then that would be a change to the semantics of the `crossorigin` attribute that I don't think were ever documented.
content.formatted_body: But even then that would be a change to the semantics of the crossorigin attribute that I don't think were ever documented.

content.body: Yoav Weiss: that's for cross-origin fetches. Those are somewhat more tricky. I forgot what Gecko did exactly there and how sound that was. I suspect all of this might still be broken in various ways.
content.formatted_body: Yoav Weiss: that's for cross-origin fetches. Those are somewhat more tricky. I forgot what Gecko did exactly there and how sound that was. I suspect all of this might still be broken in various ways.
